Sentencas: The tail gas of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis (FTS) contains unconverted syngas and gaseous hydrocarbons.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is usually treated at a high-cost and low-efficiency method, whereas it is a feasible fuel for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, we evaluated the carbon deposition temperature of the FTS tail gas obtained at various reactor pressures.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Thermodynamic calculation showed that the FTS tail gas could be used in SOFCs without the risk of carbon deposition.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: By adding 5% water, the initial non-carbon deposition temperature was dropped from 830 degrees C (without water co-feeding) to 720 degrees C. Under reforming, the syngas (H-2/CO) ratio is about 2 when it reaches equilibrium states, which can be recycled back into the FTS process.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Theoretically, a current of 6.5-7.1 A per 100 mL FTS tail gas could be generated by the SOFC.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This study demonstrates that it is promising to use the FTS tail gas as a carbon-containing fuel for SOFCs.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Highlights A new concept of the utilization of FTS tail gas as a fuel in a SOFC is developed.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: FTS tail gas can convert to syngas with H-2/CO = 2 that can be recycled back into FTS.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Co-feeding water into FTS tail gas reduces the non-carbon deposition temperature.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Theoretical current densities proved the FTS tail gas is a promising fuel for SOFCs.
Titulo: Feasibility analysis of Fischer-Tropsch synthesis tail gas as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells
